sentences.sContent: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.sCn: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.sContent: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.sCn: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.sContent: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.sCn: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

phrases.pCn: 领会别人的暗示；接受暗示

trans.tranOther: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning
